subject: Re: Edits for Royal Rehab website
preview: Good afternoon Heath  Thank you for checking about the requested website changes.  Correct, we do not want any events published on our website at the moment during this bizarre health period.  Trudy r

full_threads.body:
Good afternoon Heath

Thank you for checking about the requested website changes.

Correct, we do not want any events published on our website at the moment during this bizarre health period.

Trudy requested I make the changes to https://www.royalrehab.com.au/rehab-services/our-expertise so all done.

Take care Heath.

MARTINA FOX​

COMMUNITY RELATIONS MANAGER

235 Morrison Rd

Ryde

NSW

2112

D.

+61 2 9808 9377

E.

Martina.Fox@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Martina, 

Hope you are keeping well. 

We have been updating the below requests and have done them, except for 2: 

  • The Events: Did you still want to publish these? It looks like they may be on hold? 
  • On the page https://www.royalrehab.com.au/rehab-services/our-expertise I can't see the text that needs to be replaced? Is this still a requirement?

Hi Trudy, 

Ok noted, thanks for the update.

Hi Heath,

We are going to do the edit listed below relating to https://royalrehab.com.au/disability-supports-and-accommodation/support-services/. This one needs to be actioned. We will review once the transfer is complete to ensure the edits remain in place.

Kind regards,

Trudy.

TRUDY MCENEARNEY​

MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS MANAGER

235 Morrison Road

Ryde

NSW

2112

D.

+61 2 9808 9356

E.

Trudy.McEnearney@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Martina, 

Thanks for sending through these changes (nicely briefed!). We are awaiting the final access, which should come through next week. 

Once we have the full access, we will action the below as a priority for you.

Hi Support


Could you please make the following edits to our website:


URL
Changes
https://www.royalrehab.com.au/news-events/events
  • Duplicate most recent Royal Rehab Choir Rehearsal event so there are 2 new events on Monday 16th & 30th March 2020.
  • Insert "Lifestyle" between "Rehab" and "Choir" in above events names.
  • Replace feature image with first attached image.
  • Add new event: Lifestyle Choir Performance
  • Start Date/Time:Saturday 4 April 2020 9am-3:30pm
  • Location: West Ryde Easter Fair
  • Upload 2nd attached image for feature image
  • Add new event: Brain Injury Australia's 8th National Brain Injury Conference
  • Start Date/Time:November 23-25 2020
  • Location: The Holme Building of the University of Sydney, Camperdown.
  • Brain Injury Australia's 8th National Brain Injury Conference will be held in partnership with the University of Sydney's Brain and Mind Centre.
    It will not only feature an International Keynote Address by one of the world's leading practitioners of Positive Behaviour Support¾a comprehensive set of research-based strategies used to decrease "challenging behaviours" by making changes in the person's environment and teaching prosocial skills¾following brain injury by Dr Tim Feeney, Chief Knowledge Officer at Belvedere Health Services, a community-based rehabilitation service in New York State but Dr Feeney will also deliver a pre-Conference workshop on the 23rd November, where the strategies and results from the world's first controlled trial of Positive Behaviour Support¾with 60 Victorian Transport Accident Commission clients with TBI, co-led by Professor Jennie Ponsford and researchers from Monash University¾will be shared with attendees.
https://www.royalrehab.com.au/rehab-services/supports-home-and-community/clinical-therapies
  • Replace "- " in "Assistive technology prescription and review- including walking frames, standing frames, transfer aids." with mdash and no spaces either side of it.

https://www.royalrehab.com.au/rehab-services/our-expertise
  • Replace all the information on the "Physiotherapy" accordion page:

Physiotherapy is an important part of many rehabilitation programs, helping people to recover more quickly from injury or assist to better manage long term illness. Our physiotherapists use a variety of techniques, such as exercise, muscle training, massage and physical strategies to assist in your recovery.

Our physios are very experienced in treating the connection between brain, muscles and nerves, and helping you re-learn movements, so you can be physically as functional and effective as possible.

Sessions are conducted in the comfort of your home, in the community or at our onsite facilities including the gym and hydrotherapy pool. Our physiotherapists will begin with goals such as sitting, walking and balance. Ultimately, they aim to improve musculoskeletal wellbeing, reduce your risk of future injuries, give you greater mobility and flexibility, and manage and prevent ongoing pain.

with the following text:


Physiotherapists are experts in movement and function and play an important role helping people to recover from injury and long term illness. Our physiotherapists use a variety of therapies such as exercises for strengthening, stretching, joint mobility, balance and coordination. They also provide task specific practice to assist you with your goals which might be such things as mobilising in a wheelchair, transferring from bed to chair, standing up, walking and climbing stairs for example. Physiotherapy can be provided in various locations depending on your needs: in our well-equipped onsite gyms and hydrotherapy pool, our outdoor equipment and mobility areas, in the comfort of your home or in your local community. Ultimately, physiotherapists aim to improve musculoskeletal wellbeing, give you greater mobility and flexibility, and manage and prevent ongoing pain.
  • Change the accordion title "Exercise Psychology" to "Exercise Physiology"
https://royalrehab.com.au/disability-supports-and-accommodation/support-services/
  • Replace the following wording under the "Funding" title:

Our accommodation can be funded in different ways. Our friendly and expert staff will work with you to find and apply for the right funding and help you through the process.

Royal Rehab is an NDIS approved provider and all our disability support services and accommodation can be accessed through NDIS funding under the categories of Specialist Disability Accommodation (SDA) and Supported Independent Living (SIL). It is important that you have, or are applying for, the correct funding from the NDIS.

You can also access our accommodation under individually funded support packages including iCare, workers compensation and insurance core supports. This includes funded support services either agency managed, self-managed or a combination of both.

with the following wording:

Our accommodation can be funded in different ways. Our friendly and expert staff will work with you to find and apply for the right funding and help you through the process.

Royal Rehab is an NDIS approved provider and all our disability support services and accommodation can be accessed through NDIS funding under the categories of Specialist Disability Accommodation (SDA) and Supported Independent Living (SIL). It is important that you have, or are applying for, the correct funding from the NDIS.

Royal Rehab use prices as set by the National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) and as published in the NDIS Support Catalogue when charging for NDIS related services. All fees and charges will be detailed within your Service Agreement.

You can also access our accommodation under individually funded support packages including iCare, workers compensation and insurance core supports. This includes funded support services either agency managed, self-managed or a combination of both.


Thank you very much Support 😊



Martina Fox

Community Relations Manager

235 Morrison Road Ryde NSW 2112

PO Box 6, Ryde NSW 1680

T. +61 2 9808 9377
E. martina.fox@royalrehab.com.au

royalrehab.com.au | Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | LinkedIn

MARTINA FOX​
COMMUNITY RELATIONS MANAGER
235 Morrison Rd Ryde NSW 2112
D.
+61 2 9808 9377
E. Martina.Fox@Royalrehab.com.au
